description: [CAF] The TotalEnergies CAF African Nations Championship 2024 Qualifiers draw has been scheduled on Wednesday, 09 October 2024.
title: Africa: TotalEnergies CAF CHAN 2024 Draw to Be Conducted On Wednesday, 09 October 2024

description: [VOA] Pentagon -- U.S. Africa Command chief Gen. Michael Langley is starting to reshape the U.S. military presence on the continent following the U.S. military withdrawal from Niger.
title: Africa: Africom Chief On Threats, Way Forward for U.S. Military in Africa

description: [Afrobarometer] Surveys find widespread perceptions of unfair treatment based on people's economic status.
title: Africa: Social Cohesion - an African Collage of Imperfect Tolerance and Cautious Trust

description: [IFEX] Collaboration on International ICT Policy for East and Southern Africa (CIPESA)
title: Africa: Cipesa's 2024 State of Internet Freedom in Africa Report Examines the Interplay Between Technology and Elections.

description: [Nile Post] The Africa Centres for Disease Control and Prevention (Africa CDC) has ramped up its efforts to combat recent Mpox and Marburg virus outbreaks by enhancing public health emergency management training in Eastern Africa.
title: Africa: Africa CDC Boosts Training to Tackle Mpox and Marburg Outbreaks in Eastern Africa

description: [Nile Post] President Museveni has told African Chief Justices that it's easier to administer justice if a country is prosperous.
title: Africa: Museveni Asks Africa Chief Justices to Work for People's Prosperity

description: [Africa CDC] Addis Ababa, Ethiopia -- The Ministry of Health of the Republic of Rwanda declared a Marburg virus disease (MVD) outbreak on 27 September 2024. As of 30 September, 27 confirmed cases and 9 deaths have been reported; most of the cases are health care workers. Over 297 contacts have been registered and are under follow-up.
title: Africa: Marburg Virus Disease Outbreak in Rwanda

description: [The Conversation Africa] Recently, the US ambassador to the United Nations announced America's support for the creation of two new permanent UN security council seats for African states. Gary Wilson, a scholar of international law and relations - specifically issues related to the United Nations - argues that although Africa's time may have come, there are still hurdles to overcome.
title: Africa: UN Security Council Needs Major Changes - Permanent Seats for African Countries Is Just One

description: [The Conversation Africa] Quick question: what do these titles have in common? A Dark Continent Seeking Light; Sure, Ebola is Bad. Africa has Worse, or; Magic and Cannibalism in the African Jungle. You guessed it - they're all about Africa. But the most correct answer is they're all headlines that have appeared in the prestigious New York Times newspaper.
title: Africa: Western Media Outlets Are Trying to Fix Their Racist, Stereotypical Coverage of Africa. Is It Time African Media Did the Same?
